claim_target: A cargo train derailment occurred on October 30, 2022 at 7:25 p.m. IST, when multiple coaches of a Visakhapatnam-Palasa Passenger Express derailed in Vizianagaram, Andhra Pradesh, India after missing red signal from Visakhapatnam-Rayagada Passenger Special train. query: Andhra Pradesh: Which railway line's freight train was involved in the derailment incident in Vizianagaram, Andhra Pradesh?
evidence: Oct 30, 2023 02:43 IST Nine passengers were killed and 32 injured after a collision between two trains resulted in the derailment of bogies in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram district on Sunday. At around 7 pm on Sunday, the 08504 Visakhapatnam-Rayagada Passenger train collided with the 08532 Visakhapatnam-Palasa Passenger train. Due to the collision, two rear coaches of the Visakhapatnam-Palasa Passenger train and the train engine of the Visakhapatnam-Rayagada Passenger were derailed. advertisement FOLLOW LIVE UPDATES HERE "Bogies derailed after a train travelling along with passengers from Vizianagaram to Raigad hit a passenger train travelling on the same route from Visakapatnam to Palasa," East Central Railway CPRO said.
edited_claim: A collision between two trains resulted in the derailment of bogies in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram district on Sunday, October 30, 2022. At around 7 pm on Sunday, the 08504 Visakhapatnam-Rayagada Passenger train collided with the 08532 Visakhapatnam-Palasa Passenger train. Due to the collision, two rear coaches of the Visakhapatnam-Palasa Passenger train and the train engine of the Visakhapatnam-Rayagada Passenger were derailed. Nine passengers were killed and 32 injured in this incident.

claim_target: Chandrayaan-1 is an ongoing series of outer space missions by the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) for the exploration of the Moon. The program incorporates a lunar orbiter, an impactor, a soft lander and a rover spacecraft. It was India's first mission to the Moon, which launched on October 22, 2008. Its main purpose is enhancing our understanding of the Moon, stimulating the advancement of technology, promoting global alliances and inspiring a future generation of explorers and scientists. The Chandrayaan-1 also features a promising test bed to demonstrate technologies required for deep-space missions.
query: India: Which country operates the Chandrayaan-2 lunar orbiter and technology demonstrator mission?
evidence: Chandrayaan-2 is an Indian mission to send an orbiter, lander, and rover to the Moon. The three vehicles launched as one combined spacecraft in July 2019 to lunar orbit, and the lander, carrying the rover, attempted but failed to touch down in the Moon's southern hemisphere. The orbiter continues to study the Moon from above. The mission builds on ISRO's Chandrayaan-1 orbiter, which launched in October 2008 and operated for 10 months.
edited_claim: Chandrayaan-1 is an outer space mission by the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) for the exploration of the Moon. The program incorporated a lunar orbiter and an impactor spacecraft. It was India's first mission to the Moon, which launched on October 22, 2008. Its main purpose is enhancing our understanding of the Moon, stimulating the advancement of technology, promoting global alliances and inspiring a future generation of explorers and scientists. The Chandrayaan-1 also featured a promising test bed to demonstrate technologies required for deep-space missions. Chandrayaan-2 was an Indian mission to send an orbiter, lander, and rover to the Moon. It failed to touch down in September 2019.

claim_target: The Chandrayaan-3 is a spacecraft designed to study the lunar surface and provide data for future missions to the Moon, as part of ISRO's lunar exploration program.
query: India: Which country's space agency, ISRO, operates the Chandrayaan-2 mission to study the Moon?
evidence: India will be the fourth country to land a rover on moon after Russia, United States and China. The latest iteration of the Chandrayaan comes four years after an earlier attempt failed, with the ground crew losing contact moments before landing. It's a follow-up mission to Chandrayaan-2. Space agency ISRO has expressed confidence that the landing will take place without a hitch, as the scientists have incorporated all the valuable lessons they learnt from Chandrayaan-2.
edited_claim: The Chandrayaan-2 is a spacecraft designed to study the lunar surface and provide data for future missions to the Moon, as part of ISRO's lunar exploration program.

evidence: [6] Aryabhata was India 's first satellite , [3] named after the astronomer. It was built by ISRO , and launched by the Soviet Union as a part of the Soviet Interkosmos programme which provided access to space for friendly states.
edited_claim: The Aryabhata was the first Indian satellite developed by Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO). It is a technology demonstrator and was launched from Kapustin Yar, Astrakhan Oblast, Soviet Union in 1975 using a Kosmos-3M launch vehicle.

claim_target: The Indian privately-funded satellite, GSAT-24, was successfully launched into space by NSIL (NewSpace India Limited) under Department of Space (DoS). It aims to provide capacity coverage for Tata Play’s DTH application needs in the country through its 24 Ku-band transponders with enhanced Effective Isotropic Radiated Power (EIRP) of 53.5 dBW, resulting in more DTH channels within the same spectrum and coverage over the Indian mainland, Andaman & Nicobar and Lakshadweep islands. The satellite is configured on ISRO’s proven I-3k Bus with a mission life of 15 years.
query: Mumbai: Which satellite programme does GSAT-24 belong to and what are its aims as the first in the series?
evidence: Shri Radhakrishnan Durairaj added saying, “GSAT-24 has been the first Demand Driven communication satellite mission undertaken by NSIL post space sector reforms. The GSAT-24 satellite is ready to usher in a new era of satellite television for India. As a testament to the success of the ‘Make In India’ initiative, this satellite would support domestic broadcasting services with advanced digital TV transmission capabilities. Congratulations to the teams of NSIL, ISRO and Tata Play who have collaborated on this successful project.
edited_claim: The Indian privately-funded satellite, GSAT-24, was successfully launched into space by NSIL (NewSpace India Limited) under Department of Space (DoS). It aims to provide capacity coverage for Tata Play’s DTH application needs in the country through its 24 Ku-band transponders. The satellite is configured on ISRO’s proven I-3k Bus with a mission life of 15 years and it would support domestic broadcasting services with advanced digital TV transmission capabilities as a testament to the success of the ‘Make In India’ initiative.

claim_target: The Jnanpith Award is an Indian literary award presented annually. It is considered one of the top annual literary awards in India, along with the Sahitya Akademi Award.
query: India: Which country presents the Jnanpith Award, an annual literary prize that is one of India's most coveted?
evidence: The Jnanpith Award is the oldest and the highest Indian literary award presented annually by the Bharatiya Jnanpith to an author for their "outstanding contribution towards literature". Instituted in 1961, the award is bestowed only on Indian writers writing in Indian languages included in the Eighth Schedule to the Constitution of India and English, [a] with no posthumous conferral. [2] From 1965 till 1981, the award was given to the authors for their "most outstanding work" and consisted of a citation plaque, a cash prize and a bronze replica of Saraswati , the Hindu goddess of knowledge and wisdom. [3] [4] [5] The first recipient of the award was the Malayalam writer G. Sankara Kurup who received the award in 1965 for his collection of poems, Odakkuzhal ( The Bamboo Flute ), published in 1950.
edited_claim: The Jnanpith Award is an annual Indian literary award presented annually by Bharatiya Jnanpith since 1961. It is considered one of the top annual literary awards in India, along with the Sahitya Akademi Award. It recognizes outstanding contribution towards literature by authors writing in Indian languages and English included in the Eighth Schedule to the Constitution of India only and carries a citation plaque, a cash prize and a bronze replica of Saraswati , the Hindu goddess of knowledge and wisdom. The first recipient was G. Sankara Kurup who received the award in 1965 for his collection of poems, Odakkuzhal ( The Bamboo Flute ), published in 1950.

edited_claim: The Thiruvalluvar Award is an annual award given by the State Government of Tamil Nadu, India, in recognition of outstanding contribution towards Kural literature and its philosophy. It is named after the ancient poet-philosopher Valluvar.

edited_claim: Padma Vibhushan award is an honor bestowed by the President of India to individuals in science and engineering who have made important contributions to the advancement of knowledge in the fields of biological sciences, chemical sciences, earth and atmospheric sciences, mathematical sciences, and physical sciences. The Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize was named after the founder, Director of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), and is the country's highest science award within India. One detrimental impact of the fashion industry on the environment is the sheer amount of waste created by fashion houses and consumers alike. claim_target: Before the establishment of the Padma Awards, Indian citizens received British honors. query: India: Who advises the Government of India regarding the establishment and conferment of the Padma Awards to deserving individuals in India?
evidence: The Padma Awards are conferred on the recommendations made by the Padma Awards Committee, which is constituted by the Prime Minister every year. edited_claim: Before the establishment of the Padma Awards, Indian citizens received British honors. The Padma Awards are an honor that recognizes Indian citizens and other persons for exceptional distinguished service to the nation. They were established on January 2, 1966, by Rajendra Prasad, the President of India, on the advice of the Government of India. The Padma Awards are conferred on the recommendations made by the Padma Awards Committee, which is constituted by the Prime Minister every year. The nomination process is open to the public. Even self-nomination can be made. History and Relevance The Government of India instituted two civilian awards-Bharat Ratna & Padma Vibhushan in 1954.

edited_claim: Bangla is a distilled alcoholic beverage that is popular in Kolkata. It is usually consumed neat. claim_target: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) or country liquor is a type of alcoholic beverage made from molasses byproducts and produced in an excise-bonded warehouse. The aging process for locally manufactured IMFLs varies, with some being aged for several years and others not at all.
query: India: Which grains are used for different varieties of IMFL in India?
evidence: This is because foreign liquors made in India are made from molasses, which is a byproduct of making sugar from sugarcane, instead of grains. Types of IMFLs The various types of IMFLs are expected to be locally manufactured using their traditional methods, such as fermenting grain mash to create whiskey. Still, many IMFLs are made with a neutral spirit made from molasses, which is a waste product of the sugar industry. This makes them different from spirits made elsewhere.
edited_claim: Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) or country liquor is a type of alcoholic beverage made from molasses byproducts and produced in an excise-bonded warehouse. The aging process for locally manufactured IMFLs varies, with some being aged for several years and others not at all. In India, these are called "Indian Made Liquors" (IML).

Depending on the ingredients; however, other varieties and newer blends are also sold by distilleries. The small-batch distillation of feni has a fundamental effect on its final character, which still retains some of the delicate aromatics, congeners, and flavour elements of the juice from which it is produced.
edited_claim: Fenni is a clear distilled alcoholic beverage, commonly produced in India. The two most popular types of fenni are cashew feni and coconut fenni.
